00209 /*
00210  * No permission check is needed.
00211  */
00212 int mdd_attr_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj,
00213                  struct md_attr *ma)
00214 {
00215         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
00216         int               rc;
00217 
00218         ENTRY;
00219 
00220         rc = mdd_la_get(env, mdd_obj, &ma->ma_attr);
00221         if ((ma->ma_need & MA_INODE) != 0 && mdd_is_dead_obj(mdd_obj))
00222                 ma->ma_attr.la_nlink = 0;
00223 
00224         RETURN(rc);
00225 }
00226 
00227 /*
00228  * No permission check is needed.
00229  */
00230 static int mdd_xattr_get(const struct lu_env *env,
00231                          struct md_object *obj, struct lu_buf *buf,
00232                          const char *name)
00233 {
00234         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
00235         int rc;
00236 
00237         ENTRY;
00238 
00239         if (mdd_object_exists(mdd_obj) == 0) {
00240                 CERROR("%s: object "DFID" not found: rc = -2\n",
00241                        mdd_obj_dev_name(mdd_obj),PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)));
00242                 return -ENOENT;
00243         }
00244 
00245         /* If the object has been destroyed, then do not get LMVEA, because
00246          * it needs to load stripes from the iteration of the master object,
00247          * and it will cause problem if master object has been destroyed, see
00248          * LU-6427 */
00249         if (unlikely((mdd_obj->mod_flags & DEAD_OBJ) &&
00250                      !(mdd_obj->mod_flags & ORPHAN_OBJ) &&
00251                       strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LMV) == 0))
00252                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00253 
00254         /* If the object has been delete from the namespace, then
00255          * get linkEA should return -ENOENT as well */
00256         if (unlikely((mdd_obj->mod_flags & (DEAD_OBJ | ORPHAN_OBJ)) &&
00257                       strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LINK) == 0))
00258                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00259 
00260         mdd_read_lock(env, mdd_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00261         rc = mdo_xattr_get(env, mdd_obj, buf, name);
00262         mdd_read_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
00263 
00264         RETURN(rc);
00265 }
00266 
00267 /*
00268  * Permission check is done when open,
00269  * no need check again.
00270  */
00271 int mdd_readlink(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj,
00272                  struct lu_buf *buf)
00273 {
00274         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
00275         struct dt_object  *next;
00276         loff_t             pos = 0;
00277         int                rc;
00278         ENTRY;
00279 
00280         if (mdd_object_exists(mdd_obj) == 0) {
00281                 CERROR("%s: object "DFID" not found: rc = -2\n",
00282                        mdd_obj_dev_name(mdd_obj),PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)));
00283                 return -ENOENT;
00284         }
00285 
00286         next = mdd_object_child(mdd_obj);
00287         LASSERT(next != NULL);
00288         LASSERT(next->do_body_ops != NULL);
00289         LASSERT(next->do_body_ops->dbo_read != NULL);
00290         mdd_read_lock(env, mdd_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00291         rc = dt_read(env, next, buf, &pos);
00292         mdd_read_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
00293         RETURN(rc);
00294 }
00295 
00296 /*
00297  * No permission check is needed.
00298  */
00299 static int mdd_xattr_list(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj,
00300                           struct lu_buf *buf)
00301 {
00302         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
00303         int rc;
00304 
00305         ENTRY;
00306 
00307         mdd_read_lock(env, mdd_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00308         rc = mdo_xattr_list(env, mdd_obj, buf);
00309         mdd_read_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
00310 
00311         if (rc < 0)
00312                 RETURN(rc);
00313 
00314         /*
00315          * Filter out XATTR_NAME_LINK if this is an orphan object.  See
00316          * mdd_xattr_get().
00317          */
00318         if (unlikely(mdd_obj->mod_flags & (DEAD_OBJ | ORPHAN_OBJ))) {
00319                 char   *end = (char *)buf->lb_buf + rc;
00320                 char   *p = buf->lb_buf;
00321 
00322                 while (p < end) {
00323                         char   *next = p + strlen(p) + 1;
00324 
00325                         if (strcmp(p, XATTR_NAME_LINK) == 0) {
00326                                 if (end - next > 0)
00327                                         memmove(p, next, end - next);
00328                                 rc -= next - p;
00329                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Filtered out "XATTR_NAME_LINK
00330                                        " of orphan "DFID"\n",
00331                                        PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)));
00332                                 break;
00333                         }
00334 
00335                         p = next;
00336                 }
00337         }
00338 
00339         RETURN(rc);
00340 }
00341 
00342 int mdd_declare_object_create_internal(const struct lu_env *env,
00343                                        struct mdd_object *p,
00344                                        struct mdd_object *c,
00345                                        struct lu_attr *attr,
00346                                        struct thandle *handle,
00347                                        const struct md_op_spec *spec,
00348                                        struct dt_allocation_hint *hint)
00349 {
00350         struct dt_object_format *dof = &mdd_env_info(env)->mti_dof;
00351         const struct dt_index_features *feat = spec->sp_feat;
00352         int rc;
00353         ENTRY;
00354 
00355         if (feat != &dt_directory_features && feat != NULL) {
00356                 dof->dof_type = DFT_INDEX;
00357                 dof->u.dof_idx.di_feat = feat;
00358 
00359         } else {
00360                 dof->dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(attr->la_mode);
00361                 if (dof->dof_type == DFT_REGULAR) {
00362                         dof->u.dof_reg.striped =
00363                                 md_should_create(spec->sp_cr_flags);
00364                         if (spec->sp_cr_flags & MDS_OPEN_HAS_EA)
00365                                 dof->u.dof_reg.striped = 0;
00366                         /* is this replay? */
00367                         if (spec->no_create)
00368                                 dof->u.dof_reg.striped = 0;
00369                 }
00370         }
00371 
00372         rc = mdo_declare_create_obj(env, c, attr, hint, dof, handle);
00373 
00374         RETURN(rc);
00375 }
00376 
00377 int mdd_object_create_internal(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_object *p,
00378                                struct mdd_object *c, struct lu_attr *attr,
00379                                struct thandle *handle,
00380                                const struct md_op_spec *spec,
00381                                struct dt_allocation_hint *hint)
00382 {
00383         struct dt_object_format *dof = &mdd_env_info(env)->mti_dof;
00384         int rc;
00385         ENTRY;
00386 
00387         LASSERT(!mdd_object_exists(c));
00388 
00389         rc = mdo_create_obj(env, c, attr, hint, dof, handle);
00390 
00391         RETURN(rc);
00392 }
00393 
00394 int mdd_attr_set_internal(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_object *obj,
00395                           const struct lu_attr *attr, struct thandle *handle,
00396                           int needacl)
00397 {
00398         int rc;
00399         ENTRY;
00400 
00401         rc = mdo_attr_set(env, obj, attr, handle);
00402 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00403         if (!rc && (attr->la_valid & LA_MODE) && needacl)
00404                 rc = mdd_acl_chmod(env, obj, attr->la_mode, handle);
00405 #endif
00406         RETURN(rc);
00407 }
00408 
00409 int mdd_update_time(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_object *obj,
00410                     const struct lu_attr *oattr, struct lu_attr *attr,
00411                     struct thandle *handle)
00412 {
00413         int rc = 0;
00414         ENTRY;
00415 
00416         LASSERT(attr->la_valid & LA_CTIME);
00417         LASSERT(oattr != NULL);
00418 
00419         /* Make sure the ctime is increased only, however, it's not strictly
00420          * reliable at here because there is not guarantee to hold lock on
00421          * object, so we just bypass some unnecessary cmtime setting first
00422          * and OSD has to check it again. */
00423         if (attr->la_ctime < oattr->la_ctime)
00424                 attr->la_valid &= ~(LA_MTIME | LA_CTIME);
00425         else if (attr->la_valid == LA_CTIME &&
00426                  attr->la_ctime == oattr->la_ctime)
00427                 attr->la_valid &= ~LA_CTIME;
00428 
00429         if (attr->la_valid != 0)
00430                 rc = mdd_attr_set_internal(env, obj, attr, handle, 0);
00431         RETURN(rc);
00432 }
00433 
00434 /*
00435  * This gives the same functionality as the code between
00436  * sys_chmod and inode_setattr
00437  * chown_common and inode_setattr
00438  * utimes and inode_setattr
00439  * This API is ported from mds_fix_attr but remove some unnecesssary stuff.
00440  */
00441 static int mdd_fix_attr(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_object *obj,
00442                         const struct lu_attr *oattr, struct lu_attr *la,
00443                         const unsigned long flags)
00444 {
00445         struct lu_ucred  *uc;
00446         int               rc = 0;
00447         ENTRY;
00448 
00449         if (!la->la_valid)
00450                 RETURN(0);
00451 
00452         /* Do not permit change file type */
00453         if (la->la_valid & LA_TYPE)
00454                 RETURN(-EPERM);
00455 
00456         /* They should not be processed by setattr */
00457         if (la->la_valid & (LA_NLINK | LA_RDEV | LA_BLKSIZE))
00458                 RETURN(-EPERM);
00459 
00460         LASSERT(oattr != NULL);
00461 
00462         uc = lu_ucred_check(env);
00463         if (uc == NULL)
00464                 RETURN(0);
00465 
00466         if (la->la_valid == LA_CTIME) {
00467                 if (!(flags & MDS_PERM_BYPASS))
00468                         /* This is only for set ctime when rename's source is
00469                          * on remote MDS. */
00470                         rc = mdd_may_delete(env, NULL, NULL, obj, oattr, NULL,
00471                                             1, 0);
00472                 if (rc == 0 && la->la_ctime <= oattr->la_ctime)
00473                         la->la_valid &= ~LA_CTIME;
00474                 RETURN(rc);
00475         }
00476 
00477         if (la->la_valid == LA_ATIME) {
00478                 /* This is an atime-only attribute update for close RPCs. */
00479                 if (la->la_atime < (oattr->la_atime +
00480                                 mdd_obj2mdd_dev(obj)->mdd_atime_diff))
00481                         la->la_valid &= ~LA_ATIME;
00482                 RETURN(0);
00483         }
00484 
00485         /* Check if flags change. */
00486         if (la->la_valid & LA_FLAGS) {
00487                 unsigned int oldflags = oattr->la_flags &
00488                                 (LUSTRE_IMMUTABLE_FL | LUSTRE_APPEND_FL);
00489                 unsigned int newflags = la->la_flags &
00490                                 (LUSTRE_IMMUTABLE_FL | LUSTRE_APPEND_FL);
00491 
00492                 if ((uc->uc_fsuid != oattr->la_uid) &&
00493                     !md_capable(uc, CFS_CAP_FOWNER))
00494                         RETURN(-EPERM);
00495 
00496                 /* The IMMUTABLE and APPEND_ONLY flags can
00497                  * only be changed by the relevant capability. */
00498                 if ((oldflags ^ newflags) &&
00499                     !md_capable(uc, CFS_CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE))
00500                         RETURN(-EPERM);
00501 
00502                 if (!S_ISDIR(oattr->la_mode))
00503                         la->la_flags &= ~(LUSTRE_DIRSYNC_FL | LUSTRE_TOPDIR_FL);
00504         }
00505 
00506         if (oattr->la_flags & (LUSTRE_IMMUTABLE_FL | LUSTRE_APPEND_FL) &&
00507             (la->la_valid & ~LA_FLAGS) &&
00508             !(flags & MDS_PERM_BYPASS))
00509                 RETURN(-EPERM);
00510 
00511         /* Check for setting the obj time. */
00512         if ((la->la_valid & (LA_MTIME | LA_ATIME | LA_CTIME)) &&
00513             !(la->la_valid & ~(LA_MTIME | LA_ATIME | LA_CTIME))) {
00514                 if ((uc->uc_fsuid != oattr->la_uid) &&
00515                     !md_capable(uc, CFS_CAP_FOWNER)) {
00516                         rc = mdd_permission_internal(env, obj, oattr,
00517                                                      MAY_WRITE);
00518                         if (rc)
00519                                 RETURN(rc);
00520                 }
00521         }
00522 
00523         if (la->la_valid & LA_KILL_SUID) {
00524                 la->la_valid &= ~LA_KILL_SUID;
00525                 if ((oattr->la_mode & S_ISUID) &&
00526                     !(la->la_valid & LA_MODE)) {
00527                         la->la_mode = oattr->la_mode;
00528                         la->la_valid |= LA_MODE;
00529                 }
00530                 la->la_mode &= ~S_ISUID;
00531         }
00532 
00533         if (la->la_valid & LA_KILL_SGID) {
00534                 la->la_valid &= ~LA_KILL_SGID;
00535                 if (((oattr->la_mode & (S_ISGID | S_IXGRP)) ==
00536                         (S_ISGID | S_IXGRP)) &&
00537                     !(la->la_valid & LA_MODE)) {
00538                         la->la_mode = oattr->la_mode;
00539                         la->la_valid |= LA_MODE;
00540                 }
00541                 la->la_mode &= ~S_ISGID;
00542         }
00543 
00544         /* Make sure a caller can chmod. */
00545         if (la->la_valid & LA_MODE) {
00546                 if (!(flags & MDS_PERM_BYPASS) &&
00547                     (uc->uc_fsuid != oattr->la_uid) &&
00548                     !md_capable(uc, CFS_CAP_FOWNER))
00549                         RETURN(-EPERM);
00550 
00551                 if (la->la_mode == (umode_t) -1)
00552                         la->la_mode = oattr->la_mode;
00553                 else
00554                         la->la_mode = (la->la_mode & S_IALLUGO) |
00555                                         (oattr->la_mode & ~S_IALLUGO);
00556 
00557                 /* Also check the setgid bit! */
00558                 if (!lustre_in_group_p(uc, (la->la_valid & LA_GID) ?
00559                                        la->la_gid : oattr->la_gid) &&
00560                     !md_capable(uc, CFS_CAP_FSETID))
00561                         la->la_mode &= ~S_ISGID;
00562         } else {
00563                la->la_mode = oattr->la_mode;
00564         }
00565 
00566         /* Make sure a caller can chown. */
00567         if (la->la_valid & LA_UID) {
00568                 if (la->la_uid == (uid_t) -1)
00569                         la->la_uid = oattr->la_uid;
00570                 if (((uc->uc_fsuid != oattr->la_uid) ||
00571                      (la->la_uid != oattr->la_uid)) &&
00572                     !md_capable(uc, CFS_CAP_CHOWN))
00573                         RETURN(-EPERM);
00574 
00575                 /* If the user or group of a non-directory has been
00576                  * changed by a non-root user, remove the setuid bit.
00577                  * 19981026 David C Niemi <niemi@tux.org>
00578                  *
00579                  * Changed this to apply to all users, including root,
00580                  * to avoid some races. This is the behavior we had in
00581                  * 2.0. The check for non-root was definitely wrong
00582                  * for 2.2 anyway, as it should have been using
00583                  * CAP_FSETID rather than fsuid -- 19990830 SD. */
00584                 if (((oattr->la_mode & S_ISUID) == S_ISUID) &&
00585                 !S_ISDIR(oattr->la_mode)) {
00586                         la->la_mode &= ~S_ISUID;
00587                         la->la_valid |= LA_MODE;
00588                 }
00589         }
00590 
00591         /* Make sure caller can chgrp. */
00592         if (la->la_valid & LA_GID) {
00593                 if (la->la_gid == (gid_t) -1)
00594                         la->la_gid = oattr->la_gid;
00595                 if (((uc->uc_fsuid != oattr->la_uid) ||
00596                      ((la->la_gid != oattr->la_gid) &&
00597                       !lustre_in_group_p(uc, la->la_gid))) &&
00598                     !md_capable(uc, CFS_CAP_CHOWN))
00599                         RETURN(-EPERM);
00600 
00601                 /* Likewise, if the user or group of a non-directory
00602                  * has been changed by a non-root user, remove the
00603                  * setgid bit UNLESS there is no group execute bit
00604                  * (this would be a file marked for mandatory
00605                  * locking).  19981026 David C Niemi <niemi@tux.org>
00606                  *
00607                  * Removed the fsuid check (see the comment above) --
00608                  * 19990830 SD. */
00609                 if (((oattr->la_mode & (S_ISGID | S_IXGRP)) ==
00610                     (S_ISGID | S_IXGRP)) && !S_ISDIR(oattr->la_mode)) {
00611                         la->la_mode &= ~S_ISGID;
00612                         la->la_valid |= LA_MODE;
00613                 }
00614         }
00615 
00616         if (la->la_valid & (LA_SIZE | LA_BLOCKS)) {
00617                 if (!((flags & MDS_OWNEROVERRIDE) &&
00618                       (uc->uc_fsuid == oattr->la_uid)) &&
00619                     !(flags & MDS_PERM_BYPASS)) {
00620                         rc = mdd_permission_internal(env, obj, oattr,
00621                                                      MAY_WRITE);
00622                         if (rc != 0)
00623                                 RETURN(rc);
00624                 }
00625         }
00626 
00627         if (la->la_valid & LA_CTIME) {
00628                 /* The pure setattr, it has the priority over what is
00629                  * already set, do not drop it if ctime is equal. */
00630                 if (la->la_ctime < oattr->la_ctime)
00631                         la->la_valid &= ~(LA_ATIME | LA_MTIME | LA_CTIME);
00632         }
00633 
00634         RETURN(0);
00635 }
00636 
00643 int mdd_changelog_data_store(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *mdd,
00644                              enum changelog_rec_type type, int flags,
00645                              struct mdd_object *mdd_obj, struct thandle *handle)
00646 {
00647         const struct lu_ucred           *uc = lu_ucred(env);
00648         const struct lu_fid             *tfid;
00649         struct llog_changelog_rec       *rec;
00650         struct lu_buf                   *buf;
00651         int                              reclen;
00652         int                              rc;
00653 
00654         /* Not recording */
00655         if (!(mdd->mdd_cl.mc_flags & CLM_ON))
00656                 RETURN(0);
00657         if ((mdd->mdd_cl.mc_mask & (1 << type)) == 0)
00658                 RETURN(0);
00659 
00660         LASSERT(mdd_obj != NULL);
00661         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
00662 
00663         tfid = mdo2fid(mdd_obj);
00664 
00665         if ((type >= CL_MTIME) && (type <= CL_ATIME) &&
00666             cfs_time_before_64(mdd->mdd_cl.mc_starttime, mdd_obj->mod_cltime)) {
00667                 /* Don't need multiple updates in this log */
00668                 /* Don't check under lock - no big deal if we get an extra
00669                    entry */
00670                 RETURN(0);
00671         }
00672 
00673         flags = (flags & CLF_FLAGMASK) | CLF_VERSION;
00674         if (uc != NULL && uc->uc_jobid[0] != '\0')
00675                 flags |= CLF_JOBID;
00676 
00677         reclen = llog_data_len(changelog_rec_offset(flags & CLF_SUPPORTED));
00678         buf = lu_buf_check_and_alloc(&mdd_env_info(env)->mti_big_buf, reclen);
00679         if (buf->lb_buf == NULL)
00680                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00681         rec = buf->lb_buf;
00682 
00683         rec->cr.cr_flags = flags;
00684         rec->cr.cr_type = (__u32)type;
00685         rec->cr.cr_tfid = *tfid;
00686         rec->cr.cr_namelen = 0;
00687         mdd_obj->mod_cltime = cfs_time_current_64();
00688 
00689         if (flags & CLF_JOBID)
00690                 mdd_changelog_rec_ext_jobid(&rec->cr, uc->uc_jobid);
00691 
00692         rc = mdd_changelog_store(env, mdd, rec, handle);
00693 
00694         RETURN(rc);
00695 }
00696 
00697 static int mdd_changelog(const struct lu_env *env, enum changelog_rec_type type,
00698                          int flags, struct md_object *obj)
00699 {
00700         struct thandle *handle;
00701         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
00702         struct mdd_device *mdd = mdo2mdd(obj);
00703         int rc;
00704         ENTRY;
00705 
00706         handle = mdd_trans_create(env, mdd);
00707         if (IS_ERR(handle))
00708                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(handle));
00709 
00710         rc = mdd_declare_changelog_store(env, mdd, NULL, NULL, handle);
00711         if (rc)
00712                 GOTO(stop, rc);
00713 
00714         rc = mdd_trans_start(env, mdd, handle);
00715         if (rc)
00716                 GOTO(stop, rc);
00717 
00718         rc = mdd_changelog_data_store(env, mdd, type, flags, mdd_obj,
00719                                       handle);
00720 
00721 stop:
00722         mdd_trans_stop(env, mdd, rc, handle);
00723 
00724         RETURN(rc);
00725 }
00726 
00734 /* Precedence for choosing record type when multiple
00735  * attributes change: setattr > mtime > ctime > atime
00736  * (ctime changes when mtime does, plus chmod/chown.
00737  * atime and ctime are independent.) */
00738 static int mdd_attr_set_changelog(const struct lu_env *env,
00739                                   struct md_object *obj, struct thandle *handle,
00740                                   __u64 valid)
00741 {
00742         struct mdd_device *mdd = mdo2mdd(obj);
00743         int bits, type = 0;
00744 
00745         bits =  (valid & LA_SIZE)  ? 1 << CL_TRUNC : 0;
00746         bits |= (valid & ~(LA_CTIME|LA_MTIME|LA_ATIME)) ? 1 << CL_SETATTR : 0;
00747         bits |= (valid & LA_MTIME) ? 1 << CL_MTIME : 0;
00748         bits |= (valid & LA_CTIME) ? 1 << CL_CTIME : 0;
00749         bits |= (valid & LA_ATIME) ? 1 << CL_ATIME : 0;
00750         bits = bits & mdd->mdd_cl.mc_mask;
00751         /* This is an implementation limit rather than a protocol limit */
00752         CLASSERT(CL_LAST <= sizeof(int) * 8);
00753         if (bits == 0)
00754                 return 0;
00755 
00756         /* The record type is the lowest non-masked set bit */
00757         type = __ffs(bits);
00758 
00759         /* FYI we only store the first CLF_FLAGMASK bits of la_valid */
00760         return mdd_changelog_data_store(env, mdd, type, (int)valid,
00761                                         md2mdd_obj(obj), handle);
00762 }
00763 
00764 static int mdd_declare_attr_set(const struct lu_env *env,
00765                                 struct mdd_device *mdd,
00766                                 struct mdd_object *obj,
00767                                 const struct lu_attr *attr,
00768                                 struct thandle *handle)
00769 {
00770         int rc;
00771 
00772         rc = mdo_declare_attr_set(env, obj, attr, handle);
00773         if (rc)
00774                 return rc;
00775 
00776 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00777         if (attr->la_valid & LA_MODE) {
00778                 mdd_read_lock(env, obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00779                 rc = mdo_xattr_get(env, obj, &LU_BUF_NULL,
00780                                    XATTR_NAME_ACL_ACCESS);
00781                 mdd_read_unlock(env, obj);
00782                 if (rc == -EOPNOTSUPP || rc == -ENODATA)
00783                         rc = 0;
00784                 else if (rc < 0)
00785                         return rc;
00786 
00787                 if (rc != 0) {
00788                         struct lu_buf *buf = mdd_buf_get(env, NULL, rc);
00789                         rc = mdo_declare_xattr_set(env, obj, buf,
00790                                                    XATTR_NAME_ACL_ACCESS, 0,
00791                                                    handle);
00792                         if (rc)
00793                                 return rc;
00794                 }
00795         }
00796 #endif
00797 
00798         rc = mdd_declare_changelog_store(env, mdd, NULL, NULL, handle);
00799         return rc;
00800 }
00801 
00802 /*
00803  * LU-3671
00804  *
00805  * permission changes may require sync operation, to mitigate performance
00806  * impact, only do this for dir and when permission is reduced.
00807  *
00808  * For regular files, version is updated with permission change (see VBR), async
00809  * permission won't cause any issue, while missing permission change on
00810  * directory may affect accessibility of other objects after recovery.
00811  */
00812 static inline bool permission_needs_sync(const struct lu_attr *old,
00813                                          const struct lu_attr *new)
00814 {
00815         if (!S_ISDIR(old->la_mode))
00816                 return false;
00817 
00818         if (new->la_valid & (LA_UID | LA_GID))
00819                 return true;
00820 
00821         if (new->la_valid & LA_MODE &&
00822             new->la_mode & (S_ISUID | S_ISGID | S_ISVTX))
00823                 return true;
00824 
00825         if ((new->la_valid & LA_MODE) &&
00826             ((new->la_mode & old->la_mode) & S_IRWXUGO) !=
00827              (old->la_mode & S_IRWXUGO))
00828                 return true;
00829 
00830         return false;
00831 }
00832 
00833 /* set attr and LOV EA at once, return updated attr */
00834 int mdd_attr_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj,
00835                  const struct md_attr *ma)
00836 {
00837         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
00838         struct mdd_device *mdd = mdo2mdd(obj);
00839         struct thandle *handle;
00840         struct lu_attr *la_copy = &mdd_env_info(env)->mti_la_for_fix;
00841         struct lu_attr *attr = MDD_ENV_VAR(env, cattr);
00842         const struct lu_attr *la = &ma->ma_attr;
00843         int rc;
00844         ENTRY;
00845 
00846         /* we do not use ->attr_set() for LOV/HSM EA any more */
00847         LASSERT((ma->ma_valid & MA_LOV) == 0);
00848         LASSERT((ma->ma_valid & MA_HSM) == 0);
00849 
00850         rc = mdd_la_get(env, mdd_obj, attr);
00851         if (rc)
00852                 RETURN(rc);
00853 
00854         *la_copy = ma->ma_attr;
00855         rc = mdd_fix_attr(env, mdd_obj, attr, la_copy, ma->ma_attr_flags);
00856         if (rc)
00857                 RETURN(rc);
00858 
00859         /* no need to setattr anymore */
00860         if (la_copy->la_valid == 0) {
00861                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "%s: no valid attribute on "DFID", previous"
00862                        "valid is "LPX64"\n", mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_name,
00863                        PFID(mdo2fid(mdd_obj)), la->la_valid);
00864 
00865                 RETURN(0);
00866         }
00867 
00868         handle = mdd_trans_create(env, mdd);
00869         if (IS_ERR(handle))
00870                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(handle));
00871 
00872         rc = mdd_declare_attr_set(env, mdd, mdd_obj, la_copy, handle);
00873         if (rc)
00874                 GOTO(stop, rc);
00875 
00876         rc = mdd_trans_start(env, mdd, handle);
00877         if (rc)
00878                 GOTO(stop, rc);
00879 
00880         if (mdd->mdd_sync_permission && permission_needs_sync(attr, la))
00881                 handle->th_sync = 1;
00882 
00883         if (la->la_valid & (LA_MTIME | LA_CTIME))
00884                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "setting mtime "LPU64", ctime "LPU64"\n",
00885                        la->la_mtime, la->la_ctime);
00886 
00887         mdd_write_lock(env, mdd_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00888         if (la_copy->la_valid & LA_FLAGS)
00889                 rc = mdd_attr_set_internal(env, mdd_obj, la_copy, handle, 1);
00890         else if (la_copy->la_valid) /* setattr */
00891                 rc = mdd_attr_set_internal(env, mdd_obj, la_copy, handle, 1);
00892         mdd_write_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
00893 
00894         if (rc == 0)
00895                 rc = mdd_attr_set_changelog(env, obj, handle,
00896                                             la_copy->la_valid);
00897 
00898         GOTO(stop, rc);
00899 
00900 stop:
00901         mdd_trans_stop(env, mdd, rc, handle);
00902         return rc;
00903 }
00904 
00905 static int mdd_xattr_sanity_check(const struct lu_env *env,
00906                                   struct mdd_object *obj,
00907                                   const struct lu_attr *attr)
00908 {
00909         struct lu_ucred *uc     = lu_ucred_assert(env);
00910         ENTRY;
00911 
00912         if (attr->la_flags & (LUSTRE_IMMUTABLE_FL | LUSTRE_APPEND_FL))
00913                 RETURN(-EPERM);
00914 
00915         if ((uc->uc_fsuid != attr->la_uid) && !md_capable(uc, CFS_CAP_FOWNER))
00916                 RETURN(-EPERM);
00917 
00918         RETURN(0);
00919 }
00920 
00921 static int mdd_declare_xattr_set(const struct lu_env *env,
00922                                  struct mdd_device *mdd,
00923                                  struct mdd_object *obj,
00924                                  const struct lu_buf *buf,
00925                                  const char *name,
00926                                  int fl, struct thandle *handle)
00927 {
00928         int     rc;
00929 
00930         rc = mdo_declare_xattr_set(env, obj, buf, name, fl, handle);
00931         if (rc)
00932                 return rc;
00933 
00934         /* Only record user and layout xattr changes */
00935         if (strncmp(XATTR_USER_PREFIX, name,
00936                     sizeof(XATTR_USER_PREFIX) - 1) == 0 ||
00937             strcmp(XATTR_NAME_LOV, name) == 0) {
00938                 rc = mdd_declare_changelog_store(env, mdd, NULL, NULL, handle);
00939                 if (rc)
00940                         return rc;
00941         }
00942 
00943         /* If HSM data is modified, this could add a changelog */
00944         if (strcmp(XATTR_NAME_HSM, name) == 0) {
00945                 rc = mdd_declare_changelog_store(env, mdd, NULL, NULL, handle);
00946                 if (rc)
00947                         return rc;
00948         }
00949 
00950         rc = mdd_declare_changelog_store(env, mdd, NULL, NULL, handle);
00951         return rc;
00952 }
00953 
00954 /*
00955  * Compare current and future data of HSM EA and add a changelog if needed.
00956  *
00957  * Caller should have write-locked \param obj.
00958  *
00959  * \param buf - Future HSM EA content.
00960  * \retval 0 if no changelog is needed or changelog was added properly.
00961  * \retval -ve errno if there was a problem
00962  */
00963 static int mdd_hsm_update_locked(const struct lu_env *env,
00964                                  struct md_object *obj,
00965                                  const struct lu_buf *buf,
00966                                  struct thandle *handle)
00967 {
00968         struct mdd_thread_info *info = mdd_env_info(env);
00969         struct mdd_device      *mdd = mdo2mdd(obj);
00970         struct mdd_object      *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
00971         struct lu_buf          *current_buf;
00972         struct md_hsm          *current_mh;
00973         struct md_hsm          *new_mh;
00974         int                     rc;
00975         ENTRY;
00976 
00977         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(current_mh);
00978         if (current_mh == NULL)
00979                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00980 
00981         /* Read HSM attrs from disk */
00982         CLASSERT(sizeof(struct hsm_attrs) <= sizeof(info->mti_xattr_buf));
00983         current_buf = mdd_buf_get(env, info->mti_xattr_buf,
00984                                   sizeof(info->mti_xattr_buf));
00985         rc = mdo_xattr_get(env, mdd_obj, current_buf, XATTR_NAME_HSM);
00986         rc = lustre_buf2hsm(current_buf->lb_buf, rc, current_mh);
00987         if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENODATA)
00988                 GOTO(free, rc);
00989         else if (rc == -ENODATA)
00990                 current_mh->mh_flags = 0;
00991 
00992         /* Map future HSM xattr */
00993         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(new_mh);
00994         if (new_mh == NULL)
00995                 GOTO(free, rc = -ENOMEM);
00996         lustre_buf2hsm(buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len, new_mh);
00997 
00998         /* If HSM flags are different, add a changelog */
00999         rc = 0;
01000         if (current_mh->mh_flags != new_mh->mh_flags) {
01001                 int flags = 0;
01002                 hsm_set_cl_event(&flags, HE_STATE);
01003                 if (new_mh->mh_flags & HS_DIRTY)
01004                         hsm_set_cl_flags(&flags, CLF_HSM_DIRTY);
01005 
01006                 rc = mdd_changelog_data_store(env, mdd, CL_HSM, flags, mdd_obj,
01007                                               handle);
01008         }
01009 
01010         OBD_FREE_PTR(new_mh);
01011 free:
01012         OBD_FREE_PTR(current_mh);
01013         return(rc);
01014 }
01015 
01016 static int mdd_xattr_del(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj,
01017                          const char *name);
01018 
01023 static int mdd_xattr_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj,
01024                          const struct lu_buf *buf, const char *name,
01025                          int fl)
01026 {
01027         struct mdd_object       *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
01028         struct lu_attr          *attr = MDD_ENV_VAR(env, cattr);
01029         struct mdd_device       *mdd = mdo2mdd(obj);
01030         struct thandle          *handle;
01031         int                      rc;
01032         ENTRY;
01033 
01034         rc = mdd_la_get(env, mdd_obj, attr);
01035         if (rc)
01036                 RETURN(rc);
01037 
01038         rc = mdd_xattr_sanity_check(env, mdd_obj, attr);
01039         if (rc)
01040                 RETURN(rc);
01041 
01042         if (strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_ACL_ACCESS) == 0 ||
01043             strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_ACL_DEFAULT) == 0) {
01044                 struct posix_acl *acl;
01045 
01046                 /* user may set empty ACL, which should be treated as removing
01047                  * ACL. */
01048                 acl = posix_acl_from_xattr(&init_user_ns, buf->lb_buf,
01049                                            buf->lb_len);
01050                 if (IS_ERR(acl))
01051                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(acl));
01052                 if (acl == NULL) {
01053                         rc = mdd_xattr_del(env, obj, name);
01054                         RETURN(rc);
01055                 }
01056                 posix_acl_release(acl);
01057         }
01058 
01059         if (!strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_ACL_ACCESS)) {
01060                 rc = mdd_acl_set(env, mdd_obj, attr, buf, fl);
01061                 RETURN(rc);
01062         }
01063 
01064         handle = mdd_trans_create(env, mdd);
01065         if (IS_ERR(handle))
01066                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(handle));
01067 
01068         rc = mdd_declare_xattr_set(env, mdd, mdd_obj, buf, name, fl, handle);
01069         if (rc)
01070                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01071 
01072         rc = mdd_trans_start(env, mdd, handle);
01073         if (rc)
01074                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01075 
01076         mdd_write_lock(env, mdd_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
01077 
01078         if (strcmp(XATTR_NAME_HSM, name) == 0) {
01079                 rc = mdd_hsm_update_locked(env, obj, buf, handle);
01080                 if (rc) {
01081                         mdd_write_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
01082                         GOTO(stop, rc);
01083                 }
01084         }
01085 
01086         rc = mdo_xattr_set(env, mdd_obj, buf, name, fl, handle);
01087         mdd_write_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
01088         if (rc)
01089                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01090 
01091         if (strcmp(XATTR_NAME_LOV, name) == 0)
01092                 rc = mdd_changelog_data_store(env, mdd, CL_LAYOUT, 0, mdd_obj,
01093                                               handle);
01094         else if (strncmp(XATTR_USER_PREFIX, name,
01095                         sizeof(XATTR_USER_PREFIX) - 1) == 0 ||
01096             strncmp(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_ACCESS, name,
01097                         sizeof(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_ACCESS) - 1) == 0 ||
01098             strncmp(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_DEFAULT, name,
01099                         sizeof(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_DEFAULT) - 1) == 0)
01100                 rc = mdd_changelog_data_store(env, mdd, CL_XATTR, 0, mdd_obj,
01101                                               handle);
01102 
01103 stop:
01104         mdd_trans_stop(env, mdd, rc, handle);
01105 
01106         RETURN(rc);
01107 }
01108 
01109 static int mdd_declare_xattr_del(const struct lu_env *env,
01110                                  struct mdd_device *mdd,
01111                                  struct mdd_object *obj,
01112                                  const char *name,
01113                                  struct thandle *handle)
01114 {
01115         int rc;
01116 
01117         rc = mdo_declare_xattr_del(env, obj, name, handle);
01118         if (rc)
01119                 return rc;
01120 
01121         /* Only record system & user xattr changes */
01122         if (strncmp(XATTR_USER_PREFIX, name,
01123                         sizeof(XATTR_USER_PREFIX) - 1) == 0 ||
01124                 strncmp(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_ACCESS, name,
01125                         sizeof(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_ACCESS) - 1) == 0 ||
01126                 strncmp(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_DEFAULT, name,
01127                         sizeof(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_DEFAULT) - 1) == 0)
01128                 rc = mdd_declare_changelog_store(env, mdd, NULL, NULL, handle);
01129 
01130         return rc;
01131 }
01132 
01137 static int mdd_xattr_del(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj,
01138                          const char *name)
01139 {
01140         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
01141         struct lu_attr *attr = MDD_ENV_VAR(env, cattr);
01142         struct mdd_device *mdd = mdo2mdd(obj);
01143         struct thandle *handle;
01144         int  rc;
01145         ENTRY;
01146 
01147         rc = mdd_la_get(env, mdd_obj, attr);
01148         if (rc)
01149                 RETURN(rc);
01150 
01151         rc = mdd_xattr_sanity_check(env, mdd_obj, attr);
01152         if (rc)
01153                 RETURN(rc);
01154 
01155         handle = mdd_trans_create(env, mdd);
01156         if (IS_ERR(handle))
01157                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(handle));
01158 
01159         rc = mdd_declare_xattr_del(env, mdd, mdd_obj, name, handle);
01160         if (rc)
01161                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01162 
01163         rc = mdd_trans_start(env, mdd, handle);
01164         if (rc)
01165                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01166 
01167         mdd_write_lock(env, mdd_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
01168         rc = mdo_xattr_del(env, mdd_obj, name, handle);
01169         mdd_write_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
01170         if (rc)
01171                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01172 
01173         /* Only record system & user xattr changes */
01174         if (strncmp(XATTR_USER_PREFIX, name,
01175                                   sizeof(XATTR_USER_PREFIX) - 1) == 0 ||
01176                           strncmp(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_ACCESS, name,
01177                                   sizeof(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_ACCESS) - 1) == 0 ||
01178                           strncmp(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_DEFAULT, name,
01179                                   sizeof(POSIX_ACL_XATTR_DEFAULT) - 1) == 0)
01180                 rc = mdd_changelog_data_store(env, mdd, CL_XATTR, 0, mdd_obj,
01181                                               handle);
01182 
01183 stop:
01184         mdd_trans_stop(env, mdd, rc, handle);
01185 
01186         RETURN(rc);
01187 }
01188 
01189 /*
01190  * read lov EA of an object
01191  * return the lov EA in an allocated lu_buf
01192  */
01193 int mdd_get_lov_ea(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_object *obj,
01194                    struct lu_buf *lmm_buf)
01195 {
01196         struct lu_buf   *buf = &mdd_env_info(env)->mti_big_buf;
01197         int              rc, bufsize;
01198         ENTRY;
01199 
01200 repeat:
01201         rc = mdo_xattr_get(env, obj, buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV);
01202 
01203         if (rc == -ERANGE) {
01204                 /* mti_big_buf is allocated but is too small
01205                  * we need to increase it */
01206                 buf = lu_buf_check_and_alloc(&mdd_env_info(env)->mti_big_buf,
01207                                              buf->lb_len * 2);
01208                 if (buf->lb_buf == NULL)
01209                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01210                 goto repeat;
01211         }
01212 
01213         if (rc < 0)
01214                 RETURN(rc);
01215 
01216         if (rc == 0)
01217                 RETURN(-ENODATA);
01218 
01219         bufsize = rc;
01220         if (memcmp(buf, &LU_BUF_NULL, sizeof(*buf)) == 0) {
01221                 /* mti_big_buf was not allocated, so we have to
01222                  * allocate it based on the ea size */
01223                 buf = lu_buf_check_and_alloc(&mdd_env_info(env)->mti_big_buf,
01224                                              bufsize);
01225                 if (buf->lb_buf == NULL)
01226                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01227                 goto repeat;
01228         }
01229 
01230         lu_buf_alloc(lmm_buf, bufsize);
01231         if (lmm_buf->lb_buf == NULL)
01232                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01233 
01234         memcpy(lmm_buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_buf, bufsize);
01235         rc = 0;
01236         EXIT;
01237 
01238 out:
01239         if (rc < 0)
01240                 lu_buf_free(lmm_buf);
01241         return rc;
01242 }
01243 
01244 static int mdd_xattr_hsm_replace(const struct lu_env *env,
01245                                  struct mdd_object *o, struct lu_buf *buf,
01246                                  struct thandle *handle)
01247 {
01248         struct hsm_attrs *attrs;
01249         __u32 hsm_flags;
01250         int flags = 0;
01251         int rc;
01252         ENTRY;
01253 
01254         rc = mdo_xattr_set(env, o, buf, XATTR_NAME_HSM, LU_XATTR_REPLACE,
01255                            handle);
01256         if (rc != 0)
01257                 RETURN(rc);
01258 
01259         attrs = buf->lb_buf;
01260         hsm_flags = le32_to_cpu(attrs->hsm_flags);
01261         if (!(hsm_flags & HS_RELEASED) || mdd_is_dead_obj(o))
01262                 RETURN(0);
01263 
01264         /* Add a changelog record for release. */
01265         hsm_set_cl_event(&flags, HE_RELEASE);
01266         rc = mdd_changelog_data_store(env, mdo2mdd(&o->mod_obj), CL_HSM,
01267                                       flags, o, handle);
01268         RETURN(rc);
01269 }
01270 
01271 /*
01272  *  check if layout swapping between 2 objects is allowed
01273  *  the rules are:
01274  *  - only normal FIDs or non-system IGIFs
01275  *  - same type of objects
01276  *  - same owner/group (so quotas are still valid)
01277  */
01278 static int mdd_layout_swap_allowed(const struct lu_env *env,
01279                                    struct mdd_object *o1,
01280                                    const struct lu_attr *attr1,
01281                                    struct mdd_object *o2,
01282                                    const struct lu_attr *attr2)
01283 {
01284         const struct lu_fid     *fid1, *fid2;
01285         ENTRY;
01286 
01287         fid1 = mdo2fid(o1);
01288         fid2 = mdo2fid(o2);
01289 
01290         if (!fid_is_norm(fid1) &&
01291             (!fid_is_igif(fid1) || IS_ERR(mdd_links_get(env, o1))))
01292                 RETURN(-EBADF);
01293 
01294         if (!fid_is_norm(fid2) &&
01295             (!fid_is_igif(fid2) || IS_ERR(mdd_links_get(env, o2))))
01296                 RETURN(-EBADF);
01297 
01298         if (mdd_object_type(o1) != mdd_object_type(o2)) {
01299                 if (S_ISDIR(mdd_object_type(o1)))
01300                         RETURN(-ENOTDIR);
01301                 if (S_ISREG(mdd_object_type(o1)))
01302                         RETURN(-EISDIR);
01303                 RETURN(-EBADF);
01304         }
01305 
01306         if ((attr1->la_uid != attr2->la_uid) ||
01307             (attr1->la_gid != attr2->la_gid))
01308                 RETURN(-EPERM);
01309 
01310         RETURN(0);
01311 }
01312 
01316 static int mdd_swap_layouts(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj1,
01317                             struct md_object *obj2, __u64 flags)
01318 {
01319         struct mdd_thread_info  *info = mdd_env_info(env);
01320         struct mdd_object       *fst_o = md2mdd_obj(obj1);
01321         struct mdd_object       *snd_o = md2mdd_obj(obj2);
01322         struct lu_attr          *fst_la = MDD_ENV_VAR(env, cattr);
01323         struct lu_attr          *snd_la = MDD_ENV_VAR(env, tattr);
01324         struct mdd_device       *mdd = mdo2mdd(obj1);
01325         struct lov_mds_md       *fst_lmm, *snd_lmm;
01326         struct lu_buf           *fst_buf = &info->mti_buf[0];
01327         struct lu_buf           *snd_buf = &info->mti_buf[1];
01328         struct lu_buf           *fst_hsm_buf = &info->mti_buf[2];
01329         struct lu_buf           *snd_hsm_buf = &info->mti_buf[3];
01330         struct ost_id           *saved_oi = NULL;
01331         struct thandle          *handle;
01332         __u16                    fst_gen, snd_gen;
01333         int                      fst_fl;
01334         int                      rc;
01335         int                      rc2;
01336         ENTRY;
01337 
01338         CLASSERT(ARRAY_SIZE(info->mti_buf) >= 4);
01339         memset(info->mti_buf, 0, sizeof(info->mti_buf));
01340 
01341         /* we have to sort the 2 obj, so locking will always
01342          * be in the same order, even in case of 2 concurrent swaps */
01343         rc = lu_fid_cmp(mdo2fid(fst_o), mdo2fid(snd_o));
01344         if (rc == 0) /* same fid ? */
01345                 RETURN(-EPERM);
01346 
01347         if (rc < 0)
01348                 swap(fst_o, snd_o);
01349 
01350         rc = mdd_la_get(env, fst_o, fst_la);
01351         if (rc != 0)
01352                 RETURN(rc);
01353 
01354         rc = mdd_la_get(env, snd_o, snd_la);
01355         if (rc != 0)
01356                 RETURN(rc);
01357 
01358         /* check if layout swapping is allowed */
01359         rc = mdd_layout_swap_allowed(env, fst_o, fst_la, snd_o, snd_la);
01360         if (rc != 0)
01361                 RETURN(rc);
01362 
01363         handle = mdd_trans_create(env, mdd);
01364         if (IS_ERR(handle))
01365                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(handle));
01366 
01367         /* objects are already sorted */
01368         mdd_write_lock(env, fst_o, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
01369         mdd_write_lock(env, snd_o, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
01370 
01371         rc = mdd_get_lov_ea(env, fst_o, fst_buf);
01372         if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENODATA)
01373                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01374 
01375         rc = mdd_get_lov_ea(env, snd_o, snd_buf);
01376         if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENODATA)
01377                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01378 
01379         /* swapping 2 non existant layouts is a success */
01380         if (fst_buf->lb_buf == NULL && snd_buf->lb_buf == NULL)
01381                 GOTO(stop, rc = 0);
01382 
01383         /* to help inode migration between MDT, it is better to
01384          * start by the no layout file (if one), so we order the swap */
01385         if (snd_buf->lb_buf == NULL) {
01386                 swap(fst_o, snd_o);
01387                 swap(fst_buf, snd_buf);
01388         }
01389 
01390         /* lmm and generation layout initialization */
01391         if (fst_buf->lb_buf != NULL) {
01392                 fst_lmm = fst_buf->lb_buf;
01393                 fst_gen = le16_to_cpu(fst_lmm->lmm_layout_gen);
01394                 fst_fl  = LU_XATTR_REPLACE;
01395         } else {
01396                 fst_lmm = NULL;
01397                 fst_gen = 0;
01398                 fst_fl  = LU_XATTR_CREATE;
01399         }
01400 
01401         snd_lmm = snd_buf->lb_buf;
01402         snd_gen = le16_to_cpu(snd_lmm->lmm_layout_gen);
01403 
01404         /* increase the generation layout numbers */
01405         snd_gen++;
01406         fst_gen++;
01407 
01408         /* set the file specific informations in lmm */
01409         if (fst_lmm != NULL) {
01410                 saved_oi = &info->mti_oa.o_oi;
01411 
01412                 *saved_oi = fst_lmm->lmm_oi;
01413                 fst_lmm->lmm_layout_gen = cpu_to_le16(snd_gen);
01414                 fst_lmm->lmm_oi = snd_lmm->lmm_oi;
01415                 snd_lmm->lmm_oi = *saved_oi;
01416         } else {
01417                 if (snd_lmm->lmm_magic == cpu_to_le32(LOV_MAGIC_V1))
01418                         snd_lmm->lmm_magic = cpu_to_le32(LOV_MAGIC_V1_DEF);
01419                 else if (snd_lmm->lmm_magic == cpu_to_le32(LOV_MAGIC_V3))
01420                         snd_lmm->lmm_magic = cpu_to_le32(LOV_MAGIC_V3_DEF);
01421                 else
01422                         GOTO(stop, rc = -EPROTO);
01423         }
01424         snd_lmm->lmm_layout_gen = cpu_to_le16(fst_gen);
01425 
01426         /* Prepare HSM attribute if it's required */
01427         if (flags & SWAP_LAYOUTS_MDS_HSM) {
01428                 const int buflen = sizeof(struct hsm_attrs);
01429 
01430                 lu_buf_alloc(fst_hsm_buf, buflen);
01431                 lu_buf_alloc(snd_hsm_buf, buflen);
01432                 if (fst_hsm_buf->lb_buf == NULL || snd_hsm_buf->lb_buf == NULL)
01433                         GOTO(stop, rc = -ENOMEM);
01434 
01435                 /* Read HSM attribute */
01436                 rc = mdo_xattr_get(env, fst_o, fst_hsm_buf, XATTR_NAME_HSM);
01437                 if (rc < 0)
01438                         GOTO(stop, rc);
01439 
01440                 rc = mdo_xattr_get(env, snd_o, snd_hsm_buf, XATTR_NAME_HSM);
01441                 if (rc < 0)
01442                         GOTO(stop, rc);
01443 
01444                 rc = mdd_declare_xattr_set(env, mdd, fst_o, snd_hsm_buf,
01445                                            XATTR_NAME_HSM, LU_XATTR_REPLACE,
01446                                            handle);
01447                 if (rc < 0)
01448                         GOTO(stop, rc);
01449 
01450                 rc = mdd_declare_xattr_set(env, mdd, snd_o, fst_hsm_buf,
01451                                            XATTR_NAME_HSM, LU_XATTR_REPLACE,
01452                                            handle);
01453                 if (rc < 0)
01454                         GOTO(stop, rc);
01455         }
01456 
01457         /* prepare transaction */
01458         rc = mdd_declare_xattr_set(env, mdd, fst_o, snd_buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV,
01459                                    fst_fl, handle);
01460         if (rc != 0)
01461                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01462 
01463         if (fst_buf->lb_buf != NULL)
01464                 rc = mdd_declare_xattr_set(env, mdd, snd_o, fst_buf,
01465                                            XATTR_NAME_LOV, LU_XATTR_REPLACE,
01466                                            handle);
01467         else
01468                 rc = mdd_declare_xattr_del(env, mdd, snd_o, XATTR_NAME_LOV,
01469                                            handle);
01470         if (rc != 0)
01471                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01472 
01473         rc = mdd_trans_start(env, mdd, handle);
01474         if (rc != 0)
01475                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01476 
01477         if (flags & SWAP_LAYOUTS_MDS_HSM) {
01478                 rc = mdd_xattr_hsm_replace(env, fst_o, snd_hsm_buf, handle);
01479                 if (rc < 0)
01480                         GOTO(stop, rc);
01481 
01482                 rc = mdd_xattr_hsm_replace(env, snd_o, fst_hsm_buf, handle);
01483                 if (rc < 0) {
01484                         rc2 = mdd_xattr_hsm_replace(env, fst_o, fst_hsm_buf,
01485                                                     handle);
01486                         if (rc2 < 0)
01487                                 CERROR("%s: restore "DFID" HSM error: %d/%d\n",
01488                                        mdd_obj_dev_name(fst_o),
01489                                        PFID(mdo2fid(fst_o)), rc, rc2);
01490                         GOTO(stop, rc);
01491                 }
01492         }
01493 
01494         rc = mdo_xattr_set(env, fst_o, snd_buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV, fst_fl, handle);
01495         if (rc != 0)
01496                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01497 
01498         if (unlikely(OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_HSM_SWAP_LAYOUTS))) {
01499                 rc = -EOPNOTSUPP;
01500         } else {
01501                 if (fst_buf->lb_buf != NULL)
01502                         rc = mdo_xattr_set(env, snd_o, fst_buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV,
01503                                            LU_XATTR_REPLACE, handle);
01504                 else
01505                         rc = mdo_xattr_del(env, snd_o, XATTR_NAME_LOV, handle);
01506         }
01507 
01508         if (rc != 0) {
01509                 int steps = 0;
01510 
01511                 /* failure on second file, but first was done, so we have
01512                  * to roll back first. */
01513                 if (fst_buf->lb_buf != NULL) {
01514                         fst_lmm->lmm_oi = *saved_oi;
01515                         fst_lmm->lmm_layout_gen = cpu_to_le16(fst_gen - 1);
01516                         rc2 = mdo_xattr_set(env, fst_o, fst_buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV,
01517                                             LU_XATTR_REPLACE, handle);
01518                 } else {
01519                         rc2 = mdo_xattr_del(env, fst_o, XATTR_NAME_LOV, handle);
01520                 }
01521                 if (rc2 < 0)
01522                         goto do_lbug;
01523 
01524                 ++steps;
01525                 rc2 = mdd_xattr_hsm_replace(env, fst_o, fst_hsm_buf, handle);
01526                 if (rc2 < 0)
01527                         goto do_lbug;
01528 
01529                 ++steps;
01530                 rc2 = mdd_xattr_hsm_replace(env, snd_o, snd_hsm_buf, handle);
01531 
01532         do_lbug:
01533                 if (rc2 < 0) {
01534                         /* very bad day */
01535                         CERROR("%s: unable to roll back layout swap. FIDs: "
01536                                DFID" and "DFID "error: %d/%d, steps: %d\n",
01537                                mdd_obj_dev_name(fst_o),
01538                                PFID(mdo2fid(snd_o)), PFID(mdo2fid(fst_o)),
01539                                rc, rc2, steps);
01540                         /* a solution to avoid journal commit is to panic,
01541                          * but it has strong consequences so we use LBUG to
01542                          * allow sysdamin to choose to panic or not
01543                          */
01544                         LBUG();
01545                 }
01546                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01547         }
01548 
01549         /* Issue one changelog record per file */
01550         rc = mdd_changelog_data_store(env, mdd, CL_LAYOUT, 0, fst_o, handle);
01551         if (rc)
01552                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01553 
01554         rc = mdd_changelog_data_store(env, mdd, CL_LAYOUT, 0, snd_o, handle);
01555         if (rc)
01556                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01557         EXIT;
01558 
01559 stop:
01560         mdd_trans_stop(env, mdd, rc, handle);
01561         mdd_write_unlock(env, snd_o);
01562         mdd_write_unlock(env, fst_o);
01563 
01564         lu_buf_free(fst_buf);
01565         lu_buf_free(snd_buf);
01566         lu_buf_free(fst_hsm_buf);
01567         lu_buf_free(snd_hsm_buf);
01568         return rc;
01569 }
01570 
01571 void mdd_object_make_hint(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_object *parent,
01572                           struct mdd_object *child, const struct lu_attr *attr,
01573                           const struct md_op_spec *spec,
01574                           struct dt_allocation_hint *hint)
01575 {
01576         struct dt_object *np = parent ?  mdd_object_child(parent) : NULL;
01577         struct dt_object *nc = mdd_object_child(child);
01578 
01579         memset(hint, 0, sizeof(*hint));
01580 
01581         /* For striped directory, give striping EA to lod_ah_init, which will
01582          * decide the stripe_offset and stripe count by it. */
01583         if (S_ISDIR(attr->la_mode) &&
01584             unlikely(spec != NULL && spec->sp_cr_flags & MDS_OPEN_HAS_EA)) {
01585                 hint->dah_eadata = spec->u.sp_ea.eadata;
01586                 hint->dah_eadata_len = spec->u.sp_ea.eadatalen;
01587         } else {
01588                 hint->dah_eadata = NULL;
01589                 hint->dah_eadata_len = 0;
01590         }
01591 
01592         CDEBUG(D_INFO, DFID" eadata %p len %d\n", PFID(mdd_object_fid(child)),
01593                hint->dah_eadata, hint->dah_eadata_len);
01594         /* @hint will be initialized by underlying device. */
01595         nc->do_ops->do_ah_init(env, hint, np, nc, attr->la_mode & S_IFMT);
01596 }
01597 
01598 /*
01599  * do NOT or the MAY_*'s, you'll get the weakest
01600  */
01601 int accmode(const struct lu_env *env, const struct lu_attr *la, int flags)
01602 {
01603         int res = 0;
01604 
01605         /* Sadly, NFSD reopens a file repeatedly during operation, so the
01606          * "acc_mode = 0" allowance for newly-created files isn't honoured.
01607          * NFSD uses the MDS_OPEN_OWNEROVERRIDE flag to say that a file
01608          * owner can write to a file even if it is marked readonly to hide
01609          * its brokenness. (bug 5781) */
01610         if (flags & MDS_OPEN_OWNEROVERRIDE) {
01611                 struct lu_ucred *uc = lu_ucred_check(env);
01612 
01613                 if ((uc == NULL) || (la->la_uid == uc->uc_fsuid))
01614                         return 0;
01615         }
01616 
01617         if (flags & FMODE_READ)
01618                 res |= MAY_READ;
01619         if (flags & (FMODE_WRITE | MDS_OPEN_TRUNC | MDS_OPEN_APPEND))
01620                 res |= MAY_WRITE;
01621         if (flags & MDS_FMODE_EXEC)
01622                 res = MAY_EXEC;
01623         return res;
01624 }
01625 
01626 static int mdd_open_sanity_check(const struct lu_env *env,
01627                                 struct mdd_object *obj,
01628                                 const struct lu_attr *attr, int flag)
01629 {
01630         int mode, rc;
01631         ENTRY;
01632 
01633         /* EEXIST check */
01634         if (mdd_is_dead_obj(obj))
01635                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
01636 
01637         if (S_ISLNK(attr->la_mode))
01638                 RETURN(-ELOOP);
01639 
01640         mode = accmode(env, attr, flag);
01641 
01642         if (S_ISDIR(attr->la_mode) && (mode & MAY_WRITE))
01643                 RETURN(-EISDIR);
01644 
01645         if (!(flag & MDS_OPEN_CREATED)) {
01646                 rc = mdd_permission_internal(env, obj, attr, mode);
01647                 if (rc)
01648                         RETURN(rc);
01649         }
01650 
01651         if (S_ISFIFO(attr->la_mode) || S_ISSOCK(attr->la_mode) ||
01652             S_ISBLK(attr->la_mode) || S_ISCHR(attr->la_mode))
01653                 flag &= ~MDS_OPEN_TRUNC;
01654 
01655         /* For writing append-only file must open it with append mode. */
01656         if (attr->la_flags & LUSTRE_APPEND_FL) {
01657                 if ((flag & FMODE_WRITE) && !(flag & MDS_OPEN_APPEND))
01658                         RETURN(-EPERM);
01659                 if (flag & MDS_OPEN_TRUNC)
01660                         RETURN(-EPERM);
01661         }
01662 
01663 #if 0
01664         /*
01665          * Now, flag -- O_NOATIME does not be packed by client.
01666          */
01667         if (flag & O_NOATIME) {
01668                 struct lu_ucred *uc = lu_ucred(env);
01669 
01670                 if (uc && ((uc->uc_valid == UCRED_OLD) ||
01671                            (uc->uc_valid == UCRED_NEW)) &&
01672                     (uc->uc_fsuid != attr->la_uid) &&
01673                     !md_capable(uc, CFS_CAP_FOWNER))
01674                         RETURN(-EPERM);
01675         }
01676 #endif
01677 
01678         RETURN(0);
01679 }
01680 
01681 static int mdd_open(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj,
01682                     int flags)
01683 {
01684         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
01685         struct lu_attr *attr = MDD_ENV_VAR(env, cattr);
01686         int rc = 0;
01687 
01688         mdd_write_lock(env, mdd_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
01689 
01690         rc = mdd_la_get(env, mdd_obj, attr);
01691         if (rc != 0)
01692                 GOTO(out, rc);
01693 
01694         rc = mdd_open_sanity_check(env, mdd_obj, attr, flags);
01695         if (rc != 0)
01696                 GOTO(out, rc);
01697 
01698         mdd_obj->mod_count++;
01699         EXIT;
01700 out:
01701         mdd_write_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
01702         return rc;
01703 }
01704 
01705 static int mdd_declare_close(const struct lu_env *env,
01706                              struct mdd_object *obj,
01707                              struct md_attr *ma,
01708                              struct thandle *handle)
01709 {
01710         int rc;
01711 
01712         rc = orph_declare_index_delete(env, obj, handle);
01713         if (rc)
01714                 return rc;
01715 
01716         return mdo_declare_destroy(env, obj, handle);
01717 }
01718 
01719 /*
01720  * No permission check is needed.
01721  */
01722 static int mdd_close(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj,
01723                      struct md_attr *ma, int mode)
01724 {
01725         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
01726         struct mdd_device *mdd = mdo2mdd(obj);
01727         struct thandle    *handle = NULL;
01728         int rc, is_orphan = 0;
01729         ENTRY;
01730 
01731         if (ma->ma_valid & MA_FLAGS && ma->ma_attr_flags & MDS_KEEP_ORPHAN) {
01732                 mdd_write_lock(env, mdd_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
01733                 mdd_obj->mod_count--;
01734                 mdd_write_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
01735 
01736                 if (mdd_obj->mod_flags & ORPHAN_OBJ && !mdd_obj->mod_count)
01737                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "Object "DFID" is retained in orphan "
01738                                "list\n", PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)));
01739                 RETURN(0);
01740         }
01741 
01742         /* mdd_finish_unlink() will always set orphan object as DEAD_OBJ, but
01743          * it might fail to add the object to orphan list (w/o ORPHAN_OBJ). */
01744         /* check without any lock */
01745         is_orphan = mdd_obj->mod_count == 1 &&
01746                     (mdd_obj->mod_flags & (ORPHAN_OBJ | DEAD_OBJ)) != 0;
01747 
01748 again:
01749         if (is_orphan) {
01750                 handle = mdd_trans_create(env, mdo2mdd(obj));
01751                 if (IS_ERR(handle))
01752                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(handle));
01753 
01754                 rc = mdd_declare_close(env, mdd_obj, ma, handle);
01755                 if (rc)
01756                         GOTO(stop, rc);
01757 
01758                 rc = mdd_declare_changelog_store(env, mdd, NULL, NULL, handle);
01759                 if (rc)
01760                         GOTO(stop, rc);
01761 
01762                 rc = mdd_trans_start(env, mdo2mdd(obj), handle);
01763                 if (rc)
01764                         GOTO(stop, rc);
01765         }
01766 
01767         mdd_write_lock(env, mdd_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
01768         rc = mdd_la_get(env, mdd_obj, &ma->ma_attr);
01769         if (rc != 0) {
01770                 CERROR("Failed to get lu_attr of "DFID": %d\n",
01771                        PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)), rc);
01772                 GOTO(out, rc);
01773         }
01774 
01775         /* check again with lock */
01776         is_orphan = (mdd_obj->mod_count == 1) &&
01777                     ((mdd_obj->mod_flags & (ORPHAN_OBJ | DEAD_OBJ)) != 0 ||
01778                      ma->ma_attr.la_nlink == 0);
01779 
01780         if (is_orphan && handle == NULL) {
01781                 mdd_write_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
01782                 goto again;
01783         }
01784 
01785         mdd_obj->mod_count--; /*release open count */
01786 
01787         if (!is_orphan)
01788                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01789 
01790         /* Orphan object */
01791         /* NB: Object maybe not in orphan list originally, it is rare case for
01792          * mdd_finish_unlink() failure, in that case, the object doesn't have
01793          * ORPHAN_OBJ flag */
01794         if ((mdd_obj->mod_flags & ORPHAN_OBJ) != 0) {
01795                 /* remove link to object from orphan index */
01796                 LASSERT(handle != NULL);
01797                 rc = __mdd_orphan_del(env, mdd_obj, handle);
01798                 if (rc != 0) {
01799                         CERROR("%s: unable to delete "DFID" from orphan list: "
01800                                "rc = %d\n", lu_dev_name(mdd2lu_dev(mdd)),
01801                                PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)), rc);
01802                         /* If object was not deleted from orphan list, do not
01803                          * destroy OSS objects, which will be done when next
01804                          * recovery. */
01805                         GOTO(out, rc);
01806                 }
01807 
01808                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "Object "DFID" is deleted from orphan "
01809                        "list, OSS objects to be destroyed.\n",
01810                        PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)));
01811         }
01812 
01813         rc = mdo_destroy(env, mdd_obj, handle);
01814 
01815         if (rc != 0) {
01816                 CERROR("%s: unable to delete "DFID" from orphan list: "
01817                        "rc = %d\n", lu_dev_name(mdd2lu_dev(mdd)),
01818                        PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)), rc);
01819         }
01820         EXIT;
01821 
01822 out:
01823         mdd_write_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
01824 
01825         if (rc == 0 &&
01826             (mode & (FMODE_WRITE | MDS_OPEN_APPEND | MDS_OPEN_TRUNC)) &&
01827             !(ma->ma_valid & MA_FLAGS && ma->ma_attr_flags & MDS_RECOV_OPEN)) {
01828                 if (handle == NULL) {
01829                         handle = mdd_trans_create(env, mdo2mdd(obj));
01830                         if (IS_ERR(handle))
01831                                 GOTO(stop, rc = PTR_ERR(handle));
01832 
01833                         rc = mdd_declare_changelog_store(env, mdd, NULL, NULL,
01834                                                          handle);
01835                         if (rc)
01836                                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01837 
01838                         rc = mdd_trans_start(env, mdo2mdd(obj), handle);
01839                         if (rc)
01840                                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01841                 }
01842 
01843                 mdd_changelog_data_store(env, mdd, CL_CLOSE, mode,
01844                                          mdd_obj, handle);
01845         }
01846 
01847 stop:
01848         if (handle != NULL && !IS_ERR(handle))
01849                 mdd_trans_stop(env, mdd, rc, handle);
01850 
01851         return rc;
01852 }
01853 
01854 /*
01855  * Permission check is done when open,
01856  * no need check again.
01857  */
01858 static int mdd_readpage_sanity_check(const struct lu_env *env,
01859                                      struct mdd_object *obj)
01860 {
01861         struct dt_object *next = mdd_object_child(obj);
01862         int rc;
01863         ENTRY;
01864 
01865         if (S_ISDIR(mdd_object_type(obj)) && dt_try_as_dir(env, next))
01866                 rc = 0;
01867         else
01868                 rc = -ENOTDIR;
01869 
01870         RETURN(rc);
01871 }
01872 
01873 static int mdd_dir_page_build(const struct lu_env *env, union lu_page *lp,
01874                               size_t nob, const struct dt_it_ops *iops,
01875                               struct dt_it *it, __u32 attr, void *arg)
01876 {
01877         struct lu_dirpage       *dp = &lp->lp_dir;
01878         void                    *area = dp;
01879         int                      result;
01880         __u64                    hash = 0;
01881         struct lu_dirent        *ent;
01882         struct lu_dirent        *last = NULL;
01883         struct lu_fid            fid;
01884         int                      first = 1;
01885 
01886         if (nob < sizeof(*dp))
01887                 return -EINVAL;
01888 
01889         memset(area, 0, sizeof (*dp));
01890         area += sizeof (*dp);
01891         nob  -= sizeof (*dp);
01892 
01893         ent  = area;
01894         do {
01895                 int    len;
01896                 size_t recsize;
01897 
01898                 len = iops->key_size(env, it);
01899 
01900                 /* IAM iterator can return record with zero len. */
01901                 if (len == 0)
01902                         goto next;
01903 
01904                 hash = iops->store(env, it);
01905                 if (unlikely(first)) {
01906                         first = 0;
01907                         dp->ldp_hash_start = cpu_to_le64(hash);
01908                 }
01909 
01910                 /* calculate max space required for lu_dirent */
01911                 recsize = lu_dirent_calc_size(len, attr);
01912 
01913                 if (nob >= recsize) {
01914                         result = iops->rec(env, it, (struct dt_rec *)ent, attr);
01915                         if (result == -ESTALE)
01916                                 goto next;
01917                         if (result != 0)
01918                                 goto out;
01919 
01920                         /* osd might not able to pack all attributes,
01921                          * so recheck rec length */
01922                         recsize = le16_to_cpu(ent->lde_reclen);
01923 
01924                         if (le32_to_cpu(ent->lde_attrs) & LUDA_FID) {
01925                                 fid_le_to_cpu(&fid, &ent->lde_fid);
01926                                 if (fid_is_dot_lustre(&fid))
01927                                         goto next;
01928                         }
01929                 } else {
01930                         result = (last != NULL) ? 0 :-EINVAL;
01931                         goto out;
01932                 }
01933                 last = ent;
01934                 ent = (void *)ent + recsize;
01935                 nob -= recsize;
01936 
01937 next:
01938                 result = iops->next(env, it);
01939                 if (result == -ESTALE)
01940                         goto next;
01941         } while (result == 0);
01942 
01943 out:
01944         dp->ldp_hash_end = cpu_to_le64(hash);
01945         if (last != NULL) {
01946                 if (last->lde_hash == dp->ldp_hash_end)
01947                         dp->ldp_flags |= cpu_to_le32(LDF_COLLIDE);
01948                 last->lde_reclen = 0; /* end mark */
01949         }
01950         if (result > 0)
01951                 /* end of directory */
01952                 dp->ldp_hash_end = cpu_to_le64(MDS_DIR_END_OFF);
01953         else if (result < 0)
01954                 CWARN("build page failed: %d!\n", result);
01955         return result;
01956 }
01957 
01958 int mdd_readpage(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj,
01959                  const struct lu_rdpg *rdpg)
01960 {
01961         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
01962         int rc;
01963         ENTRY;
01964 
01965         if (mdd_object_exists(mdd_obj) == 0) {
01966                 CERROR("%s: object "DFID" not found: rc = -2\n",
01967                        mdd_obj_dev_name(mdd_obj),PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)));
01968                 return -ENOENT;
01969         }
01970 
01971         mdd_read_lock(env, mdd_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
01972         rc = mdd_readpage_sanity_check(env, mdd_obj);
01973         if (rc)
01974                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
01975 
01976         if (mdd_is_dead_obj(mdd_obj)) {
01977                 struct page *pg;
01978                 struct lu_dirpage *dp;
01979 
01980                 /*
01981                  * According to POSIX, please do not return any entry to client:
01982                  * even dot and dotdot should not be returned.
01983                  */
01984                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "readdir from dead object: "DFID"\n",
01985                        PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)));
01986 
01987                 if (rdpg->rp_count <= 0)
01988                         GOTO(out_unlock, rc = -EFAULT);
01989                 LASSERT(rdpg->rp_pages != NULL);
01990 
01991                 pg = rdpg->rp_pages[0];
01992                 dp = (struct lu_dirpage *)kmap(pg);
01993                 memset(dp, 0 , sizeof(struct lu_dirpage));
01994                 dp->ldp_hash_start = cpu_to_le64(rdpg->rp_hash);
01995                 dp->ldp_hash_end   = cpu_to_le64(MDS_DIR_END_OFF);
01996                 dp->ldp_flags = cpu_to_le32(LDF_EMPTY);
01997                 kunmap(pg);
01998                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc = LU_PAGE_SIZE);
01999         }
02000 
02001         rc = dt_index_walk(env, mdd_object_child(mdd_obj), rdpg,
02002                            mdd_dir_page_build, NULL);
02003         if (rc >= 0) {
02004                 struct lu_dirpage       *dp;
02005 
02006                 dp = kmap(rdpg->rp_pages[0]);
02007                 dp->ldp_hash_start = cpu_to_le64(rdpg->rp_hash);
02008                 if (rc == 0) {
02009                         /*
02010                          * No pages were processed, mark this for first page
02011                          * and send back.
02012                          */
02013                         dp->ldp_hash_end = cpu_to_le64(MDS_DIR_END_OFF);
02014                         dp->ldp_flags = cpu_to_le32(LDF_EMPTY);
02015                         rc = min_t(unsigned int, LU_PAGE_SIZE, rdpg->rp_count);
02016                 }
02017                 kunmap(rdpg->rp_pages[0]);
02018         }
02019 
02020         GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
02021 out_unlock:
02022         mdd_read_unlock(env, mdd_obj);
02023         return rc;
02024 }
02025 
02026 static int mdd_object_sync(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *obj)
02027 {
02028         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
02029 
02030         if (mdd_object_exists(mdd_obj) == 0) {
02031                 int rc = -ENOENT;
02032 
02033                 CERROR("%s: object "DFID" not found: rc = %d\n",
02034                        mdd_obj_dev_name(mdd_obj),
02035                        PFID(mdd_object_fid(mdd_obj)), rc);
02036                 return rc;
02037         }
02038         return dt_object_sync(env, mdd_object_child(mdd_obj),
02039                               0, OBD_OBJECT_EOF);
02040 }
02041 
02042 static int mdd_object_lock(const struct lu_env *env,
02043                            struct md_object *obj,
02044                            struct lustre_handle *lh,
02045                            struct ldlm_enqueue_info *einfo,
02046                            union ldlm_policy_data *policy)
02047 {
02048         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
02049         return dt_object_lock(env, mdd_object_child(mdd_obj), lh,
02050                               einfo, policy);
02051 }
02052 
02053 static int mdd_object_unlock(const struct lu_env *env,
02054                              struct md_object *obj,
02055                              struct ldlm_enqueue_info *einfo,
02056                              union ldlm_policy_data *policy)
02057 {
02058         struct mdd_object *mdd_obj = md2mdd_obj(obj);
02059         return dt_object_unlock(env, mdd_object_child(mdd_obj), einfo, policy);
02060 }

02072         .moo_close              = mdd_close,
02073         .moo_readpage           = mdd_readpage,
